description: Construction of a part two and single storey end of terrace house; and parking.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The external surfaces of the development shall be constructed in accordance with the materials indicated on drawing ref.010-101 and 'Design and Access Statement' received on 22 August 2007 shall only be used in the development hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 1.4, 1.5, 4.1, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The hard and soft landscaping works indicated on drawing ref: 010-102 rev.A received on 15 October 2007 shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained for the duration of the development.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and to identify and protect the trees to be retained on site, in accordance with policies 1.4, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance Note (SPG) 9: 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The car parking layout  (providing a space of 2.4m x 4.8m for a car) on drawing ref: 010-102 rev.A received on 15 October 2007 shall be marked out on site prior to first occupation of any part of the development and this space shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  	 Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policies 1.4, 4.1, 5.5, and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no additions or extensions or external alterations to the dwellinghouse, additions or extensions to the roof of the dwellinghouse, alterations to the shape of the roof of the dwellinghouse, operation or construction of a porch outside any external door of the dwellinghouse or provision within the curtilage of the dwellinghouse of any building or enclosure, shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building in accordance with policies 1.4, 1.5, 1.9, 4.1, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out, using sampling points and methods agreed with the Local Planning Authority and subsequently a risk assessment shall be prepared, following the CLEA guidance.  A scheme shall then be submitted for approval to describe the proposed methods of removal, neutralising or sealing of the contamination, and for the remedial works to be implemented before any other works commence.    Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be installed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The design and siting of the boundary fencing to the front of the house shall be informed by the requirement to retain an area of 1.5m by 1.5m pedestrian visibility splays, and those areas shall have no obstructions above a height of 0.6m at the vehicle access point. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details of boundary treatment shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the safety and security of residents, in accordance with the policies 4.1, 4.5, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan ' Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings ref. 0101-101 received on 22 August 2007 and ref. 101-102 rev. A received on 15 October 2007, the details of the development hereby approved, the proposed house shall have level access points to the main (front) entrances of the house shall be provided, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure access for all in accordance with UDP policies 4.1 and 4.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 7 'Accessible Ealing'.
